title: Why is Miami usually associated with synthwave and outrun themes? - Quora

response.answer_text: Because of the synthwave “aesthetic”. There can be different feels/atmospheres/moods/tones/ to synthwave, but one of the most common is this “neon-lit, summery, city-by-the-ocean, cruising-at-nighttime-through-the-city-after-it-just-rained” aesthetic. It just FEELS right for how the songs sound. For example, The Midnight’s newest album cover:  I think the main reason for this is pop culture. The idea of synthwave as a genre is to create a pseudo-1980’s dream place you can travel to while listening. And the way to do this is to pull from the pop culture and concepts common in the 1980s. A lot of classic 80’s films and shows with the synthwave “aesthetic” take place in Miami. Specifically, Miami Vice. I believe another influence could very well be games like Grand Theft Auto: Vice City which has that same aesthetic:  There’s also things like Beverly Hills Cop. While not all of this media takes place in Miami, they all have similar elements: a city by the ocean, palm trees, neon lights, boxy cars, sunny beaches… you get the idea.
Because Neon. Miami has a lot of neon. Also because of Miami Vice, Hotline Miami, Scarface… See the common trend here?
